topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Updating an Existing Cloud

body.p: This document provides a general description of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade patching and update processes.
If you have an existing HLM and you want to upgrade it to a newer CGHOS build, you can do so without tearing it apart.
This will help you to maintain all your existing cloud definitions and generated configuration remain intact while the Debian Repository and HLM code has been updated to the latest version.

p.b: Taking Back-Up and Preparing for Upgrade

li.pre: Take a backup of desired_state under your current cloud folder ==> If you have any custom machine_architecture.json => ensure you have a backup for this file ==> /opt/share/hlm/1/site/machine_architecture.json
Take a backup of log files mv /var/log/hlm/<cloudname> /var/log/hlm/<cloudname>-backup
Ensure accelerate process is not running under "root" user on any of the cloud nodes. If you do find such process - kill it

Reconcile any differences between Json files of the new build and the one that you have under cloud folder. Since you will be using the same jsons of the under your current cloud folder, you must ensure that if there were any new additions/subtractions into the new build's jsons
corfirm above command returned a wsrep_cluster_size that is appropriate for the build
should list all nodes in cluster under 'running_nodes'
keystone user-list (should return list of users)
Take a general inventory of all your existing networks, instances, subnets etc to compare your setup post upgrade.
If you get hung while running deploy, Kill the ansible process by pressing "ctrl c" and then try hlm deploy with rerun option
On bonded nic setups, sometimes there are network lags and you might get timeouts or failures or ssh disconnect issue. Running hlm deploy with rerun usually solves the issue.
Ensure the machine_architecture.json that you backed up is copied again under /opt/share/hlm/1/site/

p.b: Upgrade Existing HLM with New Build

li.pre: Remove old bits from ~/cg/ on KVM Host
Copy the new build bits cg-hos-misc.tar.gz cg-hos-src.tar.gz under ~/cg/ on KVM Host
Do not update your ~/infra-ansible-playbooks unless you know for sure the new bits have some code changes to infra-ansible-playbooks. Usually the change list is generated with each build.
Go to your ~/infra-ansible-playbooks folder. If you updated the infra playbooks too with new code, then update your group_vars/all file accordingly.
The above step has updated your HLM debian repo with latest deb and also has updated your HLM and Ansible code.

p.b: Upgrade Cloud Configuration with Existing Cloud Definitions (No JSON Changes in the cloud definition for adding tiers or nodes. But adding variables is fine.)

body.p: Once you have updated your HLM to be on the latest version of the CGHOS Build, you still have your existing cloud configurations (sitting under desired_state folder)
that has not been updated to the newercode.
You will have to perform some steps in order to get your existing cloud definitions updated to the latest.
If you are not interested in your existing cloud definition and updating the existing cloud itself from the current HLM, you can of course ignore these steps and create a new cloud altogether.

p.b: Update Cloud Configuration with Existing Cloud Definition (No JSON file Changes)

li.pre: Since you have a deployed cloud, you already have the cloud definition and configuration sitting under /var/hlm/clouds/<yourcloud>
In this case, we are NOT modifying any Cloud Definition JSON files. We are only updating the cloud configuration related to ansible roles and varibles.
Take a backup of your old configurations for "just in case" scenarios.
The above will update your whole cloud to the new bits

p.b: Update Cloud Configuration with NEW Cloud Definitions (JSON Changes for adding tiers) [NOT FOR GA]

body.p: Since you have a deployed cloud, you already have the cloud definition and configuration sitting under /var/hlm/clouds/<yourcloud>
Following things cannot be updated in JSON files:

ul.li: No changes pertaining to networking, new networks cannot be added or old networks cannot be removed
No changes pertaining to removal of existing tiers
No changes pertaining to removal of existing roles on tiers

body.p: In this case, we can modify the Cloud Definition JSON files but are limited to modify only following things:
